content:
Thursday, 1pm ET.
Did you know every WG's Confluence space includes a blog? We just used ours to post this exciting news.

Join us Thursday at 1 ET for our orientation to our Patient Corrections track at the January "Correctathon": https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/322275573

Here's a preview of the blog post:
image.png

@Drew Torres @Jenni Syed @Vassil Peytchev @Cooper Thompson hoping you guys can make the orientation tomorrow (or at least watch the rerun!). Of special note - we will have an expert guest panel on Thursday at 5Pm Eastern January 14th to help all of us understand the problem better which I encourage you to mark your calendars for.

Here's a tweet thread inviting patients to come Thursday. Tweet & share if you wish, particularly tagging any patient voices you know.
https://twitter.com/ePatientDave/status/1339391184788221954

Hey patient activists - do you know of dangerous errors in someone's medical record, the kind that can cause harm or diagnostic errors? Want to help improve that? Orientation for developers Thursday 1pm ET; public (YOU) is welcome. Blog post: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97471973 /thread https://twitter.com/ePatientDave/status/1339391184788221954/photo/1

- Dave deBronkart (@ePatientDave)

The Patient Request for Correction Connectathon Track Orientation starts soon! (Today at 1 PM ET)
Here are the details:
https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/322275573
You can also dial in using your phone.
United States: +1 (872) 240-3212
Access Code: 322-275-573

On our WG's Confluence blog, I've posted the recording and slides from our orientation yesterday. It was a thrill to see new faces! And word seems to be spreading in the patient advocate community on social media.
